<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Assign Role to User"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"put"}
  path={"/user-svc/user/{userId}/role/{role}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Assign a role to a user. The caller can assign any roles it owns,
typically those prefixed with the callerâ€™s identifier (e.g., `my-service:admin`).
One exception to this rule is dynamic organization roles: If the caller is an organization admin
(e.g., has a role like "user-svc:org:\{%orgId\}:admin"), they can also assign such roles.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"description":"User ID","in":"path","name":"userId","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string"}},{"description":"Role ID","in":"path","name":"roleId","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={{"content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"type":"object"}}},"description":"Add Role to User Request"}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
